title: How to Build a Talk Box

steps.title: Get a computer speaker.
steps.content: Get a computer speaker. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the casing of the speaker.
steps.content: Remove the casing of the speaker.

steps.title: Cut the wire going to the LED light.
steps.content: Cut the wire going to the LED light.

steps.title: Flip the Tupperware container upside down.
steps.content: Flip the Tupperware container upside down. The lid should be on the ground.

steps.title: Insert the speaker into the Tupperware container.
steps.content: Insert the speaker into the Tupperware container. [2] X Research source Make sure the circuit board is outside the container, only the wires and the speaker go inside.

steps.title: Make sure the speaker cone is facing the bottom of the Tupperware container, about 2" away from it.
steps.content: Make sure the speaker cone is facing the bottom of the Tupperware container, about 2" away from it.

steps.title: Duct Tape the speaker into place.
steps.content: Duct Tape the speaker into place. Make sure no Duct Tape touches the speaker cone!

steps.title: Take out a drill with a large bit, a little bit smaller that your tubing width (the tubing should be no more that 1/2"-3/4" wide).
steps.content: Take out a drill with a large bit, a little bit smaller that your tubing width (the tubing should be no more that 1/2"-3/4" wide).

steps.title: Drill a hole in the bottom of the Tupperware.
steps.content: Drill a hole in the bottom of the Tupperware. Be sure to avoid cutting into the speaker cone.

steps.title: Insert your tubing in the hole.
steps.content: Insert your tubing in the hole. [3] X Research source The tubing should be 1/2" away from the speaker cone at most. The tube must not touch the speaker cone or it won't work.

steps.title: Duct Tape the tube closed.
steps.content: Duct Tape the tube closed. [4] X Research source You might want to use some hot glue as well.

steps.title: Stuff some cotton balls behind the speaker until the whole container is full.
steps.content: Stuff some cotton balls behind the speaker until the whole container is full. Make sure the cotton balls do not touch the speaker cone.

steps.title: Close the Tupperware lid.
steps.content: Close the Tupperware lid.

steps.title: Glue the lid down.
steps.content: Glue the lid down.

steps.title: Insert the Tupperware into an airtight box.
steps.content: Insert the Tupperware into an airtight box. Put old T-shirt and socks around the Tupperware.

steps.title: Close the box.
steps.content: Close the box.

steps.title: Drill a hole in the side of the box to let the tubing go through.
steps.content: Drill a hole in the side of the box to let the tubing go through.

steps.title: Drill another hole in the box to let the cable go through.
steps.content: Drill another hole in the box to let the cable go through.

steps.title: Plug the cable into the CD or external speaker jack on your amp.
steps.content: Plug the cable into the CD or external speaker jack on your amp. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Turn up the volume to 3 o clock.
steps.content: Turn up the volume to 3 o clock. Don't worry, no sound will come out of your amplifier

steps.title: Turn the gain up to 3 o clock.
steps.content: Turn the gain up to 3 o clock.

steps.title: Put the tube next to your ear to check for sound.
steps.content: Put the tube next to your ear to check for sound.

steps.title: Put the tube in your mouth.
steps.content: Put the tube in your mouth. [6] X Research source Make lip movements, but no sound. Pretend your lip syncing. You can say whatever you want.
